title: My Add-ons Disabled by Mozilla
content:
Dear Mozilla Add-ons Team,

I am writing to follow up on the appeal I submitted regarding the disabling of my browser add-on. The appeal reference number is 548da2be-8b32-4b76-831f-20502318a5f1.

It has been some time since I submitted the appeal, but I have not yet received any update on the status of the review. My add-on is still in a disabled state, and I would appreciate any information regarding the progress of the appeal or any additional steps I need to take.

Please let me know if any further information is required from my side to assist with the process.

Thank you for your time and support.

Best regards, NCOG Developer developer@ncog.earth
creator: developer30

title: Logged out on TikTok, when trying to log in, windows security says Firefox wants me to insert security key into USB...
content:
Today I went to TikTok, was using it earlier in the day also, when it showed me logged out and when I go to log in using my email, a windows security pop up shows, saying that I should insert my security key into the USB, something I don't have, and that this is being asked because of Firefox, which I can click cancel, but when I try to sign in with my email, I can't seem to, the password doesn't seem to be working, and can't sign in with the QR code through the phone which connects with the app. Still signed in just fine on Chrome and the app on my phone, so not sure what is up, as that shows my password should be fine due to neither of those logging me out if my password had been changed.

That I changed one thing yesterday related to something "secure", was that I enabled SecureBoot in BIOS, because games like Battlefield require it now for the anti-cheat and I'm curious if this has somehow affected this in some way as that's the only thing that changed recently for me.

title: Firefox dark mode on websites not working properly
content:
For whatever reason, Firefox is choosing to change the appearance of websites when they don't have a dark mode configuration on them. For context, I have Website Appearance and Themes set to Automatic so it'll respect my system settings, and my desktop is in dark mode at all times. If I change these settings to light it will render the page properly as expected, testing in Troubleshooting Mode doesn't change the behavior so it's not an extension thing, and Chrome (and other multiple other browsers) renders everything just fine. I've also tried playing with layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override just in case (currently set to 2), but to no avail. I've also tried playing around with the contrast settings without any luck, either.

I've attached two screenshots of the LinkedIn login page from both Firefox and Chrome to show what I'm seeing. This just started happening maybe a month or so ago, and the only custom thing I've done to the Firefox theme is have it use Mica so it feels more native to Windows. I haven't ruled this out yet, but it doesn't feel like it should be related since this has nothing to do with light/dark system settings.

Appreciate any help :)
creator: bropel
